intro: Periandra heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf periandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from elliptical to ovate, depending on environmental conditions. Its small, clustered flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, flat pods containing seeds. Periandra heterophylla is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and thickets.
